Updated November     pm



The ECU chapter of the National Association for the Education of Young Children NAEYC is taking part in an annual celebration known as the Week of the Young Child PERIOD From April  activities that promote early childhood development will take place to help bring attention to the needs of young children and their families PERIOD

The NAEYC was established in  and according to the NAEYC is now 

Their goal is to consolidate the efforts of individuals and groups working together to achieve the healthy development and productive education of all children PERIOD The focus of the NAEYC is on child development from birth up to third grade which they consider the most crucial time for a childs success in school and later life PERIOD

Elizabeth Fulcher secretary of the ECU chapter of the NAEYC said her reason for becoming a part of the program is the children PERIOD

 said Fulcher PERIOD

The Week of the Young Child is an annual celebration established in  by the NAEYC in order to bring public attention to the needs of children and to recognize early childhood programs meeting those needs PERIOD

Childrens OpportunitiesOur ResponsibilityWe hope to bring out public awareness of the needs and rights of childrenWe want to take those books and deliver them to centers in need of themShe was a vital part of our department and will be greatly missed said Lori Glenn junior and member of the NAEYC PERIOD

Donations are being used to buy three copies of Jennifers favorite book Oh the Places Youll Go by Dr PERIOD Seuss PERIOD The books will be placed in the Infant Toddler and Preschool rooms of the CDL PERIOD

To find out more about the NAEYC the ECU Chapter or the Week of the Young Child contact the faculty advisor Robin McManus at mcmanusrmail.ecu.edu PERIOD

This writer can be contacted at newstheeastcarolinian.com PERIOD
